title: All About Emily Calandrelli And Her Historic Space Journey
content: Emily Calandrelli, an MIT-trained engineer and future Blue Origin astronaut, recently made history after she became the 100th woman to venture into space.
summary: Emily Calandrelli, an MIT-trained engineer and future Blue Origin astronaut, recently made history after she became the 100th woman to venture into space.

title: Rich Countries Provide No Haven From Climate Doom, Study Finds
content: Not one country is on track for a 1.5C future based on 2030 national pledges for cutting emissions, according to the Assessing Sovereign Climate-related Opportunities and Risks Project.
summary: Not one country is on track for a 1.5C future based on 2030 national pledges for cutting emissions, according to the Assessing Sovereign Climate-related Opportunities and Risks Project.

title: Google Sues Ex-Employee For Stealing, Leaking Company Secrets
content: Google has filed a lawsuit against a former employee accusing him of stealing confidential company information related to its chip designs and leaking it online.

title: "Urge Bangladesh To Ensure Minorities' Safety": India On Arrest Of Hindu Priest

title: Nepal Says No Loan Pact Will Be Signed During PM Oli's Visit To Beijing
content: Nepal Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli, who is set to embark on a five-day visit to China on December 2, has stressed that Kathmandu will not sign any loan pact under Beijing's Belt and Road Initiative (BRI).
summary: Nepal Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli, who is set to embark on a five-day visit to China on December 2, has stressed that Kathmandu will not sign any loan pact under Beijing's Belt and Road Initiative (BRI).

title: Trump's Tariff Threat On China, Mexico, Canada Hits Markets
content: President-elect Donald Trump vowed additional tariffs on China as well as US neighbors Canada and Mexico, roiling markets with his first specific threat to curb global trade flows since his election win.

title: HIV Cases, Deaths Declining But Vaccine Remains Elusive
content: The number of new HIV infections and deaths has fallen across the world, marking significant progress in the fight against the disease. But HIV is far from being stamped out, health experts warn ahead of World AIDS Day on Sunday.
summary: The number of new HIV infections and deaths has fallen across the world, marking significant progress in the fight against the disease. But HIV is far from being stamped out, health experts warn ahead of World AIDS Day on Sunday.
